thread.title: College football: Syracuse, Pitt set for noon kickoff on ESPNU
thread.title_full: College football: Syracuse, Pitt set for noon kickoff on ESPNU

title: College football: Syracuse, Pitt set for noon kickoff on ESPNU
text:
A A 
SYRACUSE — When the Syracuse football team returns to the Carrier Dome on Oct. 24, it will kick off at noon against longtime rival Pittsburgh. 
The game will be nationally televised on ESPNU. The contest between the Orange and Panthers is the centerpiece of Orange Central/Homecoming Weekend, breaking up a two-game road stretch against USF and Virginia and Syracuse’s Halloween matchup against Florida State. 
The Syracuse-Pitt series is the second-longest rivalry in the history of Orange football. The two teams have played 70 times with the Panthers holding a 36-31-3 advantage. 
The Orange last beat the Panthers 14-13 at home in 2012. Pittsburgh defeated Syracuse 17-16 in the Dome in 2013 and 30-7 at Heinz Field last season.
